school: Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg School of Public Health

sections.text: The rigorous MPH curriculum prepares students to become leading public health professionals capable of addressing global health problems with multidisciplinary, evidence‑based approaches.

The flexible program—available online or onsite, full‑ or part‑time—features hundreds of courses from over 1,500 faculty, and culminates in a capstone applying students’ competencies to a real public health problem.
Students can complete the MPH in 11 months to 4 years, with both full‑ and part‑time options and modalities including online and in‑person study.
Graduates join the largest MPH alumni network globally and assume roles across health care, government, consulting, academia, NGOs, and more.
